At 40.2(7) GPa, in addition to the standard data collection, we collected the diffraction when DAC was rotated around the X-ray beam direction by 90°. After the integration procedure, two reflection files were combined using program XRPEP
48 in order to increase data completeness and redundancy. In total, we collected 2051 reflections, which were merged based upon identical indices to 900 independent reflections with R int = 7.42%. At d = 0.8 Å completeness of the data was 42.1%. The amount of the collected data allowed us to refine the structure only in an isotropic approximation. The resulting ratio between data (900) and the number of parameters (97) was ~9. Six reflections were omitted from the refinement due to overlap with diamond peaks. The final structure was refined to convergence with R 1 = 9.61%, wR 2 = 25.99%, and GOF = 1.109 for all 900 unique reflections [ R 1 = 8.84%, wR 2 = 24.76%, for those 789 data with I > 2σ( I)]. On a final difference Fourier map, we observed no peaks higher than 1.4 e·Å −2. The most of the intense peaks were within 1 Å of the Si atoms. Values of thermal parameters of all atoms are within the normal interval (0.016–0.021 A 2).
